text: <@U6795JH6H> I cannot locate any clear guidelines on use of Julia Logo. I am holding a paid Julia course, but I am not sure if I am allowed to incorporate the Julia logo in the promotion (banner specifically). And if I am, what sort of restrictions apply.

elements.text: I cannot locate any clear guidelines on use of Julia Logo. I am holding a paid Julia course, but I am not sure if I am allowed to incorporate the Julia logo in the promotion (banner specifically). And if I am, what sort of restrictions apply.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

<https://discourse.julialang.org/t/trademark-guidelines-fair-use-policy-for-julia-name-logo/3404/4?u=cormullion> where Stefan says "You have my permission to use the Julia logo and create works derived from it for non-commercial purposes."

attachments.title: Trademark Guidelines/Fair-Use Policy for Julia name/logo
attachments.text: We’re in the process of applying for a trademark on the Julia name and sorting out related issues. It’s a bit complicated because the first entity to do business using a name is the one that can apply for a trademark in the US, which means that Julia Computing has to apply for the trademark and then transfer ownership to a foundation – which could be NumFocus or perhaps a standalone Julia Foundation which would exist primarily for the purpose of owning Julia community IP. The foundation would th...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Trademark Guidelines/Fair-Use Policy for Julia name/logo

elements.text: where Stefan says "You have my permission to use the Julia logo and create works derived from it for non-commercial purposes."

text: <@U69EQD0CD> Yes I found this post actually, but it doesn't say what applies in commercial settings.

elements.text: Yes I found this post actually, but it doesn't say what applies in commercial settings.

text: Right. if you're using it commercially you might need to negotiate a licence or something. :shrug:

elements.text: Right. if you're using it commercially you might need to negotiate a licence or something.
